summary: Based on the provided documents, Robert Shea is mentioned in the context of FBI responses to Congressional committee requests, specifically concerning COINTELPRO and an FBI informant within the New Orleans Legal Assistance Corps. The documents, all dated June 2, 1975, relate to inquiries from Congressional committees, including the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities, regarding investigations and related matters. There is no explicit role or significance of Robert Shea in the JFK assassination context mentioned in these documents. The documents suggest that the FBI was providing information to Congressional committees about various matters, including COINTELPRO and informants, and Robert Shea's name appears within this context.
key_connections: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities
significance: The provided documents do not indicate any direct significance of Robert Shea in the JFK assassination context. His mention appears to be related to FBI activities and responses to Congressional inquiries regarding COINTELPRO and informants.
